name: Winters Hotel Berlin Mitte Am Checkpoint Charlie

reviews.title: Clean, newish hotel
reviews.text: Located very close to Checkpoint Charlie and only 15 min walk to Potsdamer Platz. The Checkpoint Charlie metro stop is 5 mins walk away if you don't feel like walking! Transport is excellent.

Reception of hotel welcoming and helpful. The rooms are light, a fair size and clean. The bathrooms really nice. One point though, there is no mini bar - which is kind of strange when it wasn't built that long ago, also no air conditioning. That wasn't a problem for us - the bar in reception will let you take drinks to your room and will give you a bucket of ice if needed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel at a Reasonable Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have breakfast - it was around 12 euros each, but there are good cafes and take away shops nearby, for only a few euros.
reviews.title: What a wonderful deal! And right in the center of Berlin!

likes.disliked: — The cost of breakfast, but it was about standard in Germany

reviews.text: Overall I would recommend this hotel, it was value vs location and amenities.
reviews.title: Good combination of value, functionality and style

likes.disliked: — no washcloth in the shower, only one towel. Those thrifty Germans!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Winters Hotel Berlin Mitte for five nights. This hotel is located near the Check Point Charlie with easy access to the Kochstrasse U-Bahn and Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn station.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near a freeway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the location is not too nice, but the hotel is easily accessible between two metro stations. Rooms do not have their own air conditioning; temperature is adjusted by receptionist so it was too hot for us at night. Also, cleaning lady has a very strange way of checking if guests have left the room - she just enters the room without knocking, a bit surprizing.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

likes.liked: — hotel after renovetion, clean, new furniture, towels, sheets

reviews.text: + the overall experience was v. good - the building is newly renovated, rooms are clean and nicely furnished. Bed sheets and towel are fresh and new. Good value for money.
reviews.title: Great Value - Not the Best Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a couple of nights at the end of june 2008. Took two rooms one for my wife + i, one for our kids. Rooms were clean, bright + well decorated. Staff were friendly and helpful, as helpful as they needed to be (we didn't challenge them with anything). A little surprised that the hotel was 4* rated, more 3* we felt - facilities were quite limited, it's really just a good quality / good value room to lay your head at the end of the day, Berlin's too interesting to spend much time in your bedroom anyway.
reviews.title: Just right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location:
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great location

reviews.text: This end of Friedrichstrase, around checkpoint Charlie is pretty quiet. Good for the Jewish Museum + some posh shopping, but otherwise quite dull. Having wandered around Berlin for a few days we were all left thinking that we would rather have stayed on the other side and to the east end of the Unter Den Linden.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel at the end of June 2008 for 4 nights. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Kochstrasse U-Bahn and Checkpoint Charlie. Hotel has recently been refurbished and is very modern and clean with a good size bathroom and shower, flat screen TV and a safe (which was free). Reception staff were also very helpful. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but there are plenty of places to eat in Berlin at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Excellent Clean Hotel

likes.disliked: — Only had sparkling water in the room and bar (not a problem because it is cheaper in the shops anyway)

reviews.title: Functional hotel in a good Location
reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent location and if you like walking, you can easily get to all the key sites such as Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island, Sony Center.

reviews.title: I absolutely liked it
reviews.text: It is modern and functional though unexceptional - don't book here if you want something special from your stay as it is little more than a comfortable place to sleep.

reviews.title: Good but missing a few basics
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel as a member of a group. The room was absolutely spotless and also big enough for two people to move around without stepping on each others toes. It had a flatscreen TV and a reasonable sized bathroom. The breakfast was plenty and very good

reviews.title: Loved it, loved it, loved it
reviews.text: Location is good about 5 min away from Checkpoint Charlie station. Potsdam and Sony Centre about 15 min away as well. Hotel staff are quite friendly and room is clean and modernly furnished. Bathroom is immaculate.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: A few things were missing for a 3-star hotel though, such as a kettle, mini fridge, and alarm clock. But I still managed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Professional reception staff with very good English.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean room, not huge but plenty big enough. Very modern with new looking furnishings.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Toiletries and shoe shine pad provided. Hair drier and digital safe in room.
reviews.title: excellent value hotel

reviews.text: Shoe shining machines on every level.
reviews.title: awesome hotel all around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently refurbished and in an extremely quiet part of Berlin but just round the corner from the U Bahn at Kockstrasse (Check Point Charlie) or 2 blocks from the S Bahn at Anhalter. There is virtually no traffic and if you arrived by car then I don't think you'd have a problem parking in the street. Nice room, nice bathroom, superb shower, no bath, room temp fine, double bed with single quilts a superb idea, brilliant for couples who like different temperatures!! Free safe is very easy to use. Flat TV on wall with usual free Euro and base channels inc Sky News, plus movies and porn as in pretty much any Euro hotel. Gave us 2 completely blank door cards which you just wave over the sensor on the room door and alse the door that separates the rooms from the public areas, a nice touch we thought.
reviews.title: Deserves its current 7th best in Berlin tag!

likes.disliked: — view? lack of night life nearby.

reviews.text: Delicious round the corner (towards CPC) does indeed do a good alternative Euro brecky for E8 rather than E12 in hotel. If you prefer cooked and are up late then after 10am you can get a superb omelette in the Italian 2 blocks left out of the hotel towards Anhalter - forget name but has a SommerGarten. Looks a little run down but food excellent.
reviews.title: Exceptional value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the evening we recommend Café Orange on Oranienburger Strasse 32. Go to Anhalter and then take S Bahn up to next stop after Friedrichstrasse - the public transport really is the best way around in Berlin, you never have to wait and it all goes fast. The duck in blasamic sauce or the lamb in olive sauce are just superb and packed with taste - incredible value for just 11 Euros!
reviews.title: Best value for money in Europe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to the hotel, the bar is completely devoid of any atmosphere, best bet is probably the bar round the corner to the left. We tried the bar of the Angleterre to the right and it was nice enough but ridiculously expensive. Better doing your drinking in town really - the public transport is still perfectly OK even late at night.
reviews.title: Ideal hotel for visiting central Berlin

description: Berlin´s new and old centre mixes history and future: At Checkpoint Charlie history was written for decades. It is located in the direct neighborhood of the Potsdamer Platz, which is a symbol of Berlin’s future and its new centre with political, media, cultural- and lifestyle institutions.
